item.text: But Jacob lived in the land where his father had stayed, in the land of Canaan.

This is the account of Jacob.

Joseph, his seventeen-year-old son, was taking care of the flocks with his brothers. Now he was a youngster working with the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah, his father’s wives. Joseph brought back a bad report about them to their father.
Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his sons because he was a son born to him late in life, and he made a special tunic for him.
When Joseph’s brothers saw that their father loved him more than any of them, they hated Joseph and were not able to speak to him kindly.
Joseph had a dream, and when he told his brothers about it they hated him even more.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them, “<st data-num="08085 04994">Listen</st> to <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="02472 0834">dream</st> I <st data-num="02492" class="">had</st>:<n id="1" />

<st data-num="02009" class="">There</st> <st data-num="0587" class="">we</st> were,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0481" class="">binding</st> <st data-num="0485" class="">sheaves of grain</st> in the <st data-num="08432" class="">middle</st> of the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st>. <st data-num="02009" class="">Suddenly</st> my <st data-num="0485" class="">sheaf</st> <st data-num="06965" class="">rose up</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">and</st> <st data-num="05324" class="">stood upright</st> <st data-num="02009" class="">and</st> your <st data-num="0485" class="">sheaves</st> <st data-num="05437" class="">surrounded</st> my <st data-num="0485" class="">sheaf</st> and <st data-num="07812" class="">bowed down</st><n id="2" /> to it!”
Then his brothers asked him, “Do you really think you will rule over us or have dominion over us?” They hated him even more because of his dream and because of what he said.
Then he had another dream, and told it to his brothers. “Look,” he said. “I had another dream. The sun, the moon, and eleven stars were bowing down to me.”

When he <st data-num="05608 0413">told</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="0413">and</st> his <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st>, his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="01605" class="">rebuked</st> him, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> is <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="02472" class="">dream</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> you <st data-num="02492" class="">had</st>?<n id="1" /> Will <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st>, your <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st>, and your <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">really</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> and <st data-num="07812" class="">bow</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">down</st> to you?”<n id="2" />
His brothers were jealous of him, but his father kept in mind what Joseph said.
When his brothers had gone to graze their father’s flocks near Shechem,

<st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st>, “Your <st data-num="03808 0251">brothers</st><n id="1" /> are <st data-num="07462" class="">grazing</st> the flocks near <st data-num="07927" class="">Shechem</st>. <st data-num="01980" class="">Come</st>, I will <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> you <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them.” “I’m <st data-num="02009" class="">ready</st>,”<n id="2" /> Joseph <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>.<n id="3" />
So Jacob said to him, “Go now and check on the welfare of your brothers and of the flocks, and bring me word.” So Jacob sent him from the valley of Hebron.
When Joseph reached Shechem, a man found him wandering in the field, so the man asked him, “What are you looking for?”

He <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “<st data-num="0595" class="">I</st>’m <st data-num="01245" class="">looking for</st> my <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st>. <st data-num="04994" class="">Please</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">tell</st><n id="1" /> me <st data-num="0375" class="">where</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> are <st data-num="07462" class="">grazing</st> their flocks.”
The man said, “They left this area, for I heard them say, ‘Let’s go to Dothan.’” So Joseph went after his brothers and found them at Dothan.
Now Joseph’s brothers saw him from a distance, and before he reached them, they plotted to kill him.

They <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">one</st> <st data-num="0251" class="">another</st>, “<st data-num="02009" class="">Here</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">comes</st> <st data-num="01976" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01167" class="">master</st> of <st data-num="02472" class="">dreams</st>!<n id="1" />
Come now, let’s kill him, throw him into one of the cisterns, and then say that a wild animal ate him. Then we’ll see how his dreams turn out!”
When Reuben heard this, he rescued Joseph from their hands, saying, “Let’s not take his life!”

Reuben continued, “Don’t shed blood! Throw him into this cistern that is here in the wilderness, but don’t lay a hand on him.” (Reuben said this so he could rescue Joseph from them and take him back to his father.)
When Joseph reached his brothers, they stripped him of his tunic, the special tunic that he wore.
Then they took him and threw him into the cistern. (Now the cistern was empty; there was no water in it.)
When they sat down to eat their food, they looked up and saw a caravan of Ishmaelites coming from Gilead. Their camels were carrying spices, balm, and myrrh down to Egypt.

Then <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> <st data-num="01215" class="">profit</st> is there <st data-num="03588" class="">if</st> we <st data-num="02026" class="">kill</st> our <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> and <st data-num="03680" class="">cover</st> up his <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st>?

<st data-num="01980" class="">Come</st>, let’s <st data-num="04376" class="">sell</st> him to the <st data-num="03459" class="">Ishmaelites</st>, but let’s <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">lay</st> a <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> on him,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> after all, <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> is our <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st>, our own <st data-num="01320" class="">flesh</st>.” His <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">agreed</st>.<n id="2" />
So when the Midianite merchants passed by, Joseph’s brothers pulled him out of the cistern and sold him to the Ishmaelites for 20 pieces of silver. The Ishmaelites then took Joseph to Egypt.
Later Reuben returned to the cistern to find that Joseph was not in it! He tore his clothes,

<st data-num="07725" class="">returned</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st>, and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “The <st data-num="03206" class="">boy</st> <st data-num="0369" class="">isn’t there</st>! And <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st>, <st data-num="0575" class="">where</st> can <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">go</st>?”

So they <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph’s</st> <st data-num="03801" class="">tunic</st>, <st data-num="07819" class="">killed</st> a <st data-num="08163" class="">young</st> <st data-num="05795" class="">goat</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="02881" class="">dipped</st> the <st data-num="03801" class="">tunic</st> in the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st>.
Then they brought the special tunic to their father and said, “We found this. Determine now whether it is your son’s tunic or not.”
He recognized it and exclaimed, “It is my son’s tunic! A wild animal has eaten him! Joseph has surely been torn to pieces!”

Then <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> <st data-num="07167" class="">tore</st> his <st data-num="08071" class="">clothes</st>, <st data-num="07760" class="">put</st> <st data-num="04975" class="">on</st> <st data-num="08242" class="">sackcloth</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="056" class="">mourned</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="07227" class="">many</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>.
All his sons and daughters stood by him to console him, but he refused to be consoled. “No,” he said, “I will go to the grave mourning my son.” So Joseph’s father wept for him.
Now in Egypt the Midianites sold Joseph to Potiphar, one of Pharaoh’s officials, the captain of the guard.
